title: Calories in Prosecco
meta_description: Discover calories in prosecco per glass, including carbs, alcohol content, and nutrition facts for this sparkling wine. Get quick serving tips and variations.
assumptions: Standard dry (brut) prosecco, 11% ABV, per 150 ml (5 oz) serving glass; no added mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, sweetness level (brut vs. extra dry), alcohol content, and serving size. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard 150 ml glass of prosecco contains about 110 kcal, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Mixed with soda water (spritzer, same volume)

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of prosecco?
faqs.a: About 110 kcal in a standard 150 ml glass of dry prosecco.
Yes, around 2.7 g carbs per 150 ml glass, mostly sugars from grapes.
Similar; both ~70-80 kcal per 100 ml, depending on sweetness.

faqs.q: Does prosecco have fat or protein?
faqs.a: Negligibleâ€”0 g fat and ~0.2 g protein per glass.

faqs.q: How does sweetness affect calories in prosecco?
faqs.a: Brut is lowest (~110 kcal/glass); extra dry or demi-sec adds 10-30 kcal from sugars.
